definition: to win by a surprise move

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
odd (number)
strange/odd/weird/wonderful/surprisingly/unusually
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)

sentences.english: The bayonet squad made a surprise attack and wiped out the enemy's command post.
sentences.chinese: 尖刀班出奇制勝，搗毀了敵人指揮部。

sentences.english: Different strategies can be used in English advertising to draw people's attention and to win people over.
sentences.chinese: 廣告往往以不同的語言策略出奇制勝。

sentences.english: He confuses his opponents with his drunken shape and defeats his opponents by surprising move.
sentences.chinese: 形醉意不醉，用醉態迷惑對手，出奇制勝。

sentences.english: Interview process, talking about good first sentence, often a surprise move.
sentences.chinese: 面試過程中，講好第一句話，常常可以出奇制勝。

definition: (military) human wave attack
